etymology.description: 彳(彳) (chì, "walk") + 止(止) (zhǐ, "foot" or "to stop") -> 𣥆 -> stylized as 龰 -> 辵
etymology.interpretation: The character 辵 combines 彳(彳) (chì, "walk"), which represents movement, with 止(止) (zhǐ, "foot" or "to stop"), suggesting the concept of stepping or traveling forward. This character represents the idea of movement, particularly the action of walking or traveling, as originally depicted by the more conservative form 𣥆. Over time, the bottom component has been stylized as 龰, forming the current representation.

examples.chinese: 他辵在乡间的小路上(他辵在鄉間的小路上)。
examples.pinyin: Tā chuò zài xiāngjiān de xiǎolù shàng.
examples.english: He walks on the rural path.

examples.chinese: 晨光洒满大地(晨光灑滿大地)，他辵出门开始旅程(他辵出門開始旅程)。
examples.pinyin: Chén guāng sǎ mǎn dàdì, tā chuò chūmén kāishǐ lǚchéng.
examples.english: As the morning light fills the earth, he sets out to begin his journey.
